page.title: 05THE AVERAGE FARM
page.content:
The average farm size in the area is 250 acres, 75-80% of which is used to grow winter wheat. The remaining acreage is used to grow oilseed rape, peas, winter barley, spring barley, potatoes and sugar beet.
Some farmers have their own reservoir for irrigation purposes, mainly for the potato crop. The reservoir of one farmer holds 5.4 million gallons and he has a licence to fill it from a river during the winter months.
These farmers only employ one or two farm labourers and so at harvest time they use casual workers from the town. Very few farmers' wives work on the farm even at harvest time, although many are involved in the book-keeping and office work.
